page.title: 16HOUSING IN OUR AREA
page.content: I live on an estate of council houses some of which are being bought by the tenants.A typical house has either 2 or 3 bedrooms, bathroom and toilet upstairs and living room, kitchen and utility room downstairs. Most have gardens back and front. There are also flats and maisonettes in Pennywell. S.Hylton has a nucleus of 18th & 19th century houses and the village centre has terraced houses and cottages. There is an inter war council estate and a recently built estate of detached private housing on the site of the former Ford Paper Mill. Cox Green, on the river, has a variety of housing - incl. prefabs and stone built houses. The parts of Grindon,Castletown and Washington have council housing-those at Washington being "modern" designs.
